intro: Xyris leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Xyridaceae family, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, exhibiting a clump-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in spike-like inflorescences, blooming in late spring to early summer. Xyris leptophylla is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding.
